intro: Tapeinophallus rivierei, commonly known as the Rivière's orchid, is a rare and distinctive member of the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring a complex and intricate labellum that plays a role in pollination. Native to the humid forests of Central Africa, this plant thrives in shaded, moist environments. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, displaying a range of colors from white to pale yellow. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
